summary: The speaker, identified as Patrick Ryder, US Air Force Brigadier General, addresses the topic of U.S. involvement in Ukraine. He clarifies that there are no plans to send U.S. service members to fight in Ukraine, reiterating the president's stance on this matter. Regarding assistance to Ukraine, he emphasizes that while he can only speak broadly from a Department of Defense (DOD) perspective, significant efforts have been made to provide security assistance to Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion. He highlights that this support is part of an international effort.
keywords: Ukraine, Russia, invasion, U.S. service members, security assistance, international effort, Patrick Ryder, US Air Force, DOD, president, no plans to fight
creator_demographic: Age Range: Unknown, Gender: Unknown, Geographic Location: Washington D.C., USA
